docs.lead_paragraph: For women with a high risk of breast cancer, an experimental procedure that retrieves cells from the milk ducts may help guide difficult decisions about preventive treatment. High-risk women include those with certain genetic mutations or family histories of breast cancer, and women who have already had cancer in one breast and are worried about the other. They face a variety of choices, like whether to undergo increased monitoring and mammograms, take the drug tamoxifen or even have their breasts removed.

headline.main: A New Test For Women At High Risk For Cancer
